news.title: Cluster redevelopment, policy reforms key to fixing Mumbai’s housing affordability crisis: MHADA’s Sanjeev Jaiswal
news.para: At ET Realty Real Estate Conclave 2026, the MHADA Vice-President and CEO outlines a cluster-led redevelopment roadmap, policy recalibration and rental housing push to address Mumbai’s affordability and supply challenges.

news.title: Valiyangadi mishap: Kozhikode corporation orders structural audit of all its buildings
news.para: Four people died and one was injured when a five-decade-old corporation-owned building collapsed in Kozhikode. The mayor defended the civic body, stating a decision to rebuild was made in 2022 but tenants were not asked to vacate due to social implications. A comprehensive report and enquiry have been ordered.

news.title: Visakhapatnam: GVMC begins zone-wise development plan preparation after administrative reorganisation
news.para: Visakhapatnam's municipal corporation has reorganized into 10 zones, aligning with Assembly constituencies to improve local governance. Consultations are underway to develop comprehensive zonal and ward-level plans, addressing issues like drainage, water supply, and infrastructure gaps. This move aims to streamline service delivery and boost decentralized development across the city.

news.title: Ahmedabad: Illegal constructions removed from Vadu lake in Chandkheda’
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation's estate department carried out demolitions in Chandkheda and Vejalpur. Illegal structures were removed from Vadu Lake and Ropda Lake. A new road was opened in Ghatlodia after demolishing shops and houses. Actions were also taken regarding LIG scheme houses in Thaltej, with one sealed and others issued notices. A construction site was fined for air pollution.

news.title: Major urban expansion on cards in Haryana, HSVP to buy land, launch new sectors in Gurugram after 20 years
news.para: Haryana Shahari Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) is launching a large-scale land procurement plan to develop new residential and commercial sectors after a 20-year hiatus. The initiative aims to ease pressure on existing urban centers and provide serviced plots under planned development norms, with phased procurement beginning next month.

news.title: Telangana plans debt revamp, land monetisation as it moves to acquire Hyderabad metro phase I from L&T
news.para: Telangana is taking over the Hyderabad Metro Rail network from L&T. This ₹15,000 crore deal marks a significant state government acquisition. The state will formally assume control in April. Key areas include financial restructuring, asset transfer, and ensuring uninterrupted operations. Discussions are underway for a ₹13,000 crore loan from Indian Railway Finance Corporation.

news.title: Nine multi-storey buildings among 100 structures razed on KMP link in Gurugram
news.para: Authorities in Gurugram successfully cleared nearly 100 encroachments along a 1.5-km stretch of the Farrukhnagar–Daboda road, restoring its sanctioned width. The five-day demolition drive aimed to ease traffic congestion and improve safety on this vital link to the KMP Expressway. Redevelopment of the reclaimed stretch is planned to enhance traffic flow and connectivity.

news.title: Infra.Market raises ₹1,250 crore in debt ahead of IPO
news.para: The debentures will be secured through hypothecation of certain company assets and pledge of promoter shareholding and shares of group companies, including RDC Concrete, Neptune Readymix, and Robo Quarries. The funds will mostly be used to refinance existing borrowings.

news.title: FIR against seller, buyer for illegal land sale in Dehradun
news.para: Dehradun administration filed an FIR against a seller and buyer for illegally selling court-prohibited land. The 0.76-hectare plot in Aamwala Tarla was sold using forged documents, despite being linked to PACL and Golden Forest assets. The mutation request was denied, and the sub-registrar's office is under investigation.

news.title: NCLAT orders handover of maintenance of two Supertech housing projects to AoAs
news.para: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal has ordered the handover of day-to-day maintenance at two Supertech housing projects. Residents' associations will now manage essential services at Ecociti and 34 Pavilion. This decision follows years of waiting for residents. The transfer must be completed within 30 days under supervision. This empowers apartment owners with control over their societies' upkeep.

news.title: Floodplain to finances, CAG flags Ghaziabad development body's ‘major lapses’ over five years
news.para: A critical CAG report reveals significant failures at Ghaziabad Development Authority from 2017 to 2022. The audit found planning violations, weak enforcement, and shortfalls in housing delivery and financial management. Master Plan 2021 was implemented without vetting. Parks and open spaces were not developed as planned. Housing for the economically weaker sections also saw a major deficit.

news.title: Karnataka RERA steps up crackdown on unregistered projects, flags regulatory gaps
news.para: Karnataka Rera is intensifying its crackdown on unregistered real estate projects to protect homebuyers. The authority has received hundreds of complaints regarding non-compliant developments. Officials are verifying project statuses and initiating action against promoters, highlighting challenges in enforcement due to independent planning approvals and low buyer awareness.

news.title: Uttarakhand constitutes 14-member panel to review and revise building bylaws
news.para: On the directions of Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami, Chief Secretary Anand Bardhan has constituted a 14-member high-level committee to review and revise the existing by-laws.

news.title: Rajkot: Residents in tears after losing homes in demolition drive; seek rehabilitation
news.para: Rajkot Municipal Corporation's extensive demolition drive in Jangleshwar has displaced over 1,400 families, leaving many without shelter. While residents lament the lack of rehabilitation, authorities claim the action is crucial for removing encroachments and curbing a significant rise in crime, including weapon possession and drug-related offenses.

news.title: SC refuses to stay Haldwani eviction drive, directs Uttarakhand to verify PMAY eligibility
news.para: A Bench comprising Chief Justice of India (CJI) Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi refused to stay the eviction but acknowledged that thousands of families are likely to be uprooted. The Court, therefore, directed the State to verify their eligibility under PMAY and submit a detailed status report before the next hearing.

news.title: Over 1,000 construction sites in Mumbai served stop-work notices: Maharashtra minister
news.para: Maharashtra government and civic authorities are intensifying their crackdown on Mumbai's air pollution, issuing over 1,000 stop-work notices to construction sites for environmental norm violations. Nearly 88% of active sites have installed air quality sensors, with strict penalties for non-compliance. The state is also deploying water tankers and misting machines to combat dust.

news.title: Cabinet approves extension of Gujarat metro from GIFT City to Shahpur
news.para: The Union Cabinet has approved a new 3.33-km extension for the Gujarat Metro. This new route will connect GIFT City to Shahpur. The project is expected to be completed in four years. It will feature three elevated stations. This extension will significantly improve connectivity between Ahmedabad and the GIFT region. The project will also create jobs during construction and operation.

news.title: ADB commits $108 million to Aavas Financiers for affordable housing loans
news.para: Asian Development Bank is providing a significant loan package of up to USD 108 million to Aavas Financiers. This funding aims to boost access to affordable housing for lower-income families and business loans for MSMEs. The initiative will particularly focus on underserved regions across India. A portion of the financing is dedicated to promoting green and climate-resilient housing solutions.

news.title: Centre approves construction of 5,000 houses for displaced people in Manipur
news.para: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan approved 5,000 houses for internally displaced persons in Manipur. These homes will be built under the Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana-Gramin. The approval follows a meeting with Manipur Chief Minister Yumnam Khemchand Singh. The violence has displaced thousands since May 2023. The state government aims to resettle 10,000 families by March 31.

news.title: Berkshire Hathaway's Ajit Jain buys ₹85-crore apartment in Gurugram
news.para: Ajit Jain, vice-chairman of insurance operations at Berkshire Hathaway and a close aide of Warren Buffett, has purchased a 7,400 sq ft apartment at DLF’s ultra-luxury project The Camellias in Gurugram for around ₹85 crore. Industry sources say NRIs account for over 25% of DLF’s ultra-luxury sales, with premium amenities and gated living driving demand among ultra-high-net-worth individuals.
